title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk - BBC News
summary: man jailed for child sex offences .
families pay tribute to car crash teens .
more people risking their lives on rail tracks .

documents.title: norwich city 1-3 fulham
text: norwich city 1-3 fulham

documents.title: our live coverage today
text: that 's all from the norfolk live team for the day - and for the week .
we 're now taking a break , and will be back at 08:00 on tuesday .
before we go , we 'll remind you of some of the stories we 've brought you today :
have a good weekend .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the true source of hope at easter
text: rev suzanne cooke explains that the eternal love of god is what gives her hope during the good friday moments of life .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: inquest into teen crash deaths opens
text: inquest into teen crash deaths opens

documents.title: repair work to seaside town 's yacht pond
text: cromer 's yacht pond has been refurbished and refilled , as part of north norfolk district council 's ( nndc ) improvement plans for north lodge park .
the work , which cost £ 8,500 , saw the leaking pond drained and lined with glass-reinforced plastic , and the outside given a coating of non-toxic mineral paint .
cllr nigel pearce describes the pond as `` an iconic part of the town '' , adding its refurbishment will `` bring fun and happiness to the next generation of children and their parents '' .
other plans for the park include internal improvements to the cafe ( below ) , repairs to the timber footbridge and refurbishments to the bowling green and sunken garden shelters .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: families pay tribute to car crash trio
text: the families of three teenagers who died following a fatal collision at pulham market last week have released tributes to the young men .
davina o'neill , the mother of 18-year-old dominic o'neill , who lived in pulham market , describes her son as a beautiful , much loved person who will be greatly missed by many .
she adds that she 's been `` overwhelmed by the support and love from his friends . ''

the family of kyle warren , 17 , remember him as a `` very cheeky chappie , who always had a wonderful smile on his face no matter what he was an extremely loving person , especially to all his family and friends .
he was very outgoing and loved in return by all kyle will be sadly missed and never forgotten . ''
kyle , who lived in harleston , had a passion for banger racing and had won several trophies .
billy hines ' family say the 16-year-old from wortham made everyone smile from the day he was born .
`` he was a funny , loving , caring , hard working boy and always had a cheeky smile on his face .
he brought so much joy to everyone he met and touched so many hearts .
he was as someone said 'one in a million ' '' .
the trio had been travelling in a black ford ka when the collision took place on the tivetshall road , towards pulham market , shortly before midnight on wednesday , 5 april .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: britain 's first female firefighter writes book about her experiences
text: it was n't until 1982 that the fire service employed a woman .
the first female fighter was jo reynolds .
she started training when she was just 17-years-old , and thetford was her first base .
`` i was absolutely terrified i thought they would think 'who is this woman ' it was terrifying , like a first day at a new school '' .
jo explains she had a good training course , and would n't have got through unless she was good enough .
`` if i was n't up to standard , i would 've been out i 'd have left of my own accord or they 'd have kicked me out . ''
five years later , jo passed her hgv test to become the country 's first female driver of a fire engine ( above ) .
now , 35 years later and urged on by friends , she 's written a book about her experiences .

documents.title: illegal rave warning
text: norfolk police are asking people to report any sus activity around open land or disused buildings during the easter bank holiday weekend .
it 's in a bid to prevent any illegal raves or unlicensed music events ( ume ) .
ch supt nick davison says early intervention in preventing and disrupting such events is key , and in the past the response from the public has been extremely useful .
the police will also be monitoring social networking sites .
members of the public are asked to inform the police if they see any of the following :
anyone organising an illegal rave or ume faces prosecution , as well as having their sound equipment seized .
vehicles trying to enter or leave sites will be dealt with for any offences they might be committing .

documents.title: man jailed for child sex offences
text: a man has been given a jail term after admitting child sex offences .
andrew blyth , of north walsham road , bacton was sentenced at norwich crown court yesterday .
the 56-year-old was jailed after admitting three counts of sexual activity with a female child under the age of 16 , which occurred between 1 january and 10 february this year .
blyth was also placed on the sex offenders register for life and given a sexual harm prevention order indefinitely .
det con andy vinsen , of the child abuse investigation unit , praised the victim for the courage she showed throughout their investigation .
we will always investigate any allegations of sexual abuse thoroughly and as a consequence bring offenders to justice . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: irvine disappointed by martin departure
text: irvine disappointed by martin departure

documents.title: norfolk tourist economy 'better than cornwall '
text: did you know 40 million day trippers head to norfolk each year ?
well , we 're just hours away from the bank holiday weekend and thousands of tourists will be heading here to to enjoy our coast , countryside and the fine city of norwich .
pete waters is the executive director of visit east anglia , and he says our tourism economy is stronger than that in cornwall .
`` everybody talks about cornwall and how tourism is doing there the cornwall visitor economy is worth £ 2.4bn a year - ours is worth £ 3bn a year . ''
but pete says there 's scope for more :
it we can convert a small percentage of those day trippers to stay visitors that would really develop the visitor economy even more . ''

documents.title: fancy b & b at a stately home ?
text: a stately home dating back to the tudor period is offering the public the chance to stay on a b & b basis , costing £ 2,600 a night .
lord somerleyton said when they first came up with the idea , it was `` curiosity to see who might look us up and how it might work '' .
lady somerleyton described welcoming their first guests , who 've already sampled the delights of the property , as `` really fantastic '' .
if you 're interested in the history of the hall , there 's been a residence on the site since the beginning of the norman conquest of britain , with a manor house there as early as 1240 ad .

documents.title: young archer 's win a first for britain
text: a norwich teenager who 's representing great britain at archery is hoping to win more medals and titles in the future .
layla annison , 14 , recently won a bronze medal at the european indoor championships in france in the under-21 category .
it was britain 's first ever individual medal at an indoor international event .
this summer layla , who 's studying for her gcse 's , will be competing in cambridge , croatia and then the world championships in argentina .
it was really exciting wearing the gb shirt and shooting for your country , when i got on the podium and got my medal i was so happy , really really over the moon . ''
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: concerns for missing father-of-one
text: motorists are being asked to help police find a missing man .
nigel kedar has been missing from his clacton home for more than a week .
the 52-year-old visited norwich on 2 april and was last seen two days later , walking along the a140 at pulham market in the direction of the a14 .
det ch insp marie james says it 's likely that mr kedar was walking home , as the route - the a12 , a14 , a140 into norwich - is one he 's familiar with .
police are asking for any drivers with dash cams , who may have travelled on the road on that day , to come forward with their footage .
our concerns are increasing every day it 's very much out-of-character for nigel not to be in contact with family and friends , he has a young son who he 'd regularly be in contact with . ''

documents.title: international horse trials under way
text: if you want to see some of the stars of the horse world close up , then the burnham market horse trials is the place to be .
world class riders and 700 horses will be competing over the next three days .
among those taking part will be the queen 's granddaughter zara tindall , and olympians sir mark todd and oliver townend .
event organiser alec lochore says the riders will find it quite a testing course .

it 's a difficult course , i think it 's very fair the riders will be the judge of that , they 'll tell us in the next 24 hours what they think there 's some properly difficult combinations out there . ''
author: Jill Bennett
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: canaries confirm back room departures
text: norwich city have announced the departures of technical director ricky martin and scouts lee darnborough and tony spearing .
martin had been at the club since 2001 , when he joined as an associate schoolboy .
spearing , a former city player , had been in the role of head of football recruitment for the last year , while darnborough joined as head of scouting two years ago .
club statement : ricky martin # ncfc
turning into a good week now ricky has no where to hide anymore bye bye
we wo n't miss youuu
sad day when you see this happen to long service staff that did a great job for the club otbc
they fired the wrong martin it was supposed to be russell not ricky
thank the lord
leaving la vida loca ?
was he caught livin la vida loca ?
get in
club statement : lee darnbrough and tony spearing # ncfc
good riddance
it 's happening
clear out
need to clear some of the shit players out
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: a cloudy but dry afternoon
text: despite the cloudy skies , this afternoon will remain dry , with the best of any brightness in the south of the county .
we can expect a maximum temperature of 12c ( 54f ) .
despite the light winds , it was breezy enough for this glider in west norfolk .
click here to find out how you can be a bbc weather watcher .

documents.title: more people risk their lives on rail tracks
text: more people than ever are risking their lives by trespassing on rail tracks in norfolk , according to figures released by network rail and british transport police .
there were around 93 incidents in norfolk last year , a 50 % rise on the previous year .
the data shows that , nationally , one person trespasses every hour .
it also shows young people are more likely to take a risk on the tracks , with peaks coinciding with the spring and summer school holidays .
richard tew is network rail 's head of safety for anglia .
he warns that taking a shortcut , or playing on the tracks , is not only illegal but also very dangerous .

the dangers may not always be obvious but the electricity on the railway is always on and trains can travel up to 100mph , so even if they see you they ca n't stop in time taking a shortcut or messing around can result in serious life-changing injuries or death . ''

documents.title: webber 's revolution begins for canaries
text: three senior figures to leave carrow road as chief gets to work - the back page of the eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: callous carer who stole from elderly is jailed
text: woman took war medals from vulnerable patients - the story on the front page of the eastern daily press today :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: wolf reintroduction branded 'fake news '
text: wolf reintroduction branded 'fake news '

documents.title: crash teens died of multiple injuries
text: three teenagers who were killed after their vehicle left the road and crashed into trees all died of multiple injuries , an inquest opening has heard .
the three males died at the scene , after their black ford ka crashed off the tivetshall road , near pulham market , shortly before midnight on 5 april .
an inquest into the deaths of dominic o'neill , 18 , 17-year-old kyle warren and 16-year-old billy hines was opened and adjourned at norfolk coroner 's court in norwich .
norfolk 's senior coroner jacqueline lake recorded the medical cause of death as multiple injuries due to a road traffic collision in respect of all three .
no details were given as to who was driving the vehicle .
they were pronounced dead at the scene .
dominic , who was unemployed , lived in pulham market .
farmhand kyle lived in harleston , and billy , a student , lived in wortham , suffolk .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tiny twins 'faced huge challenges '
text: esme and iris wilson , born more than 16 weeks early , are some of the shortest gestation twins to have been successfully treated at the norfolk and norwich university hospital .
consultant neonatologist dr priya muthukumar , part of the team who looked after the girls , says babies born that early can face huge challenges in terms of their health development .

`` we are very humbled by the strength and determination josie has shown throughout these 113 days and are grateful to her for consenting to participate in research studies that are currently happening in the unit '' .
toy rabbits given to the tiny sisters when they were born on 16 december were considerably larger than the twins .
now , the girls have outgrown their cuddly companions - with esme weighing in at 2.4kg ( 5lb 7oz ) and iris at 2.3kg ( 5lb 4oz ) .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: premature twins head home
text: a set of twins born more than 16 weeks early have gone home from hospital , just one day after their original due date .
esme and iris wilson were born on 16 december at 23 weeks and 6 days , and have spent 113 days being cared for at the neonatal intensive care unit at the norfolk and norwich university hospital .
iris , who arrived first , weighed in at just 660g ( 1lb 7oz ) and her sister esme was born 15 minutes later , at 630g ( 1lb 6oz ) .
there was just time for a quick cuddle with mum josie wilson , before they were taken for specialist care .
josie says the sisters were so tiny that she knew there 'd be a tough journey ahead , and it would be down to the girls to fight through .
we 've overcome some big hurdles iris was transferred to another hospital for laser eye surgery , and the twins were both born with heart murmurs which are continuing to improve . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: poultry farmers 'to remain vigilant '
text: all poultry in england will be allowed outside from today , after being kept indoors since december to protect them from a strain of bird flu .
mark gorton is a free-range poultry farmer , from south norfolk .
he says bird flu is a constant threat to business and farmers have to remain vigilant at all times .
he adds that it 's been a difficult time for those in the industry .

the birds we have are meant to be free-range , they 're bred to be free-range and that 's what they want to do , so we 've really had our work cut out over the winter months keeping birds active and the high levels of welfare that we aim for . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: spoof wolf posters spark public concern
text: posters suggesting that wolves are being introduced at a suffolk nature reserve have forced a wildlife trust to reassure the public .
several flyers were put up at knettishall heath around 1 april , advising visitors to carry flare guns and not to enter the heath after dark .
suffolk wildlife trust said it has received `` a number of concerned messages '' , following the april fool 's prank .
sam norris , knettishall ranger , says they 're working to restore it to the kind of landscape that bronze age dwellers would have recognised , but wolves would be a step too far .
`` i can categorically say that this definitely does not involve re-introducing wolves .
`` just to be clear , there are no plans to introduce wolves anywhere in suffolk , '' she said .

documents.title: poultry restrictions relaxed
text: restrictions on free range poultry farmers and egg producers are being relaxed today .
flocks in `` high risk '' areas have had to be housed indoors since december to protect them against bird flu .
in february , 20,000 chickens were culled following an outbreak of the virus at bridge farm , in redgrave , on the norfolk/suffolk border .
last month , a precautionary cull of 55,000 ducks took place at a neighbouring farm .
nigel gibbens , chief veterinary officer , says we can not rule out the threat that this bird flu , or a different strain , will return in future years .

we will maintain surveillance internationally , we 'll maintain our surveillance domestically , to be as alert as we can so that if we need to , we can take measures working with the farming sector again . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

top temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .

documents.title: good morning norfolk
text: hello and thanks for joining us for a new day on norfolk live .
throughout the day we 'll be here , bringing you the latest news updates from across the county .
if there 's anything happening where you live that you 'd like to share with us , click on the `` get involved '' button at the top of the page to get in touch .
a chilly start to the day , but we can expect to see some sunshine later - sara thornton will have the full forecast for you shortly .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage for today
text: that 's it for today folks .
our live coverage will resume from 08:00 tomorrow but any major breaking stories overnight will still appear in the stream .
you can scroll back to see what 's been happening across norfolk today .
a few stories to highlight :
have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : much colder overnight and sunny spells tomorrow
text: this evening will be rather cloudy with the chance of a few spots of light rain .
skies will clear later , leaving low overnight temperatures of 3c - that 's 37f .
tomorrow will start chilly but it will be mainly dry with sunny spells and the odd isolated shower .
highs of 12c , that 's 54f .
weather has more local forecasts .

documents.title: first essex bus accepting train travellers on some routes
text: we have been told that first essex bus will accept greater anglia tickets on some routes .
those are the numbers 71 , 72 , 100 and 351 .
greater anglia said they would be giving out as much information as possible to travellers affected by the disruption .
follow them on twitter @ twitterid
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: works by famous sculptor head for uea
text: three life-size sculptures by antony gormley - best known for the angel of the north - are to go on display at the university of east of anglia .
the installations will be officially unveiled on 22 april and have been curated by the sainsbury centre .
the curators hope the sculptures will provoke discussions exploring the relationship between man and nature .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: death at chelmsford train station 'not sus
text: we have just had this statement from the british transport police :
`` officers were called to chelmsford railway station at around 15:50 today to reports that a person had been struck by a train .
`` the ambulance service were also called but sadly a man was pronounced dead at the scene .
`` we are working to identify him and inform his next-of-kin .
`` the incident is not currently being treated as sus

documents.title: latest situation at chelmsford train station
text: we have been on the phone to greater anglia to find out the latest details on the train situation .
they said a person was hit by a train just before 16:00 .
london-bound services are being terminated at witham or colchester .
braintree and colchester-bound trains are being terminated at shenfield .
rail replacement services are currently being arranged to serve stations from witham to shenfield and braintree to witham .
norwich-bound services out of london are being terminated at shenfield .
disruption is expected until 19:00 .
emergency services are at the scene in chelmsford .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: breakingdisruption on greater anglia railway line
text: trains from london to norwich are set to be disrupted after a person was hit by a train at chelmsford rail station .
the station is being evacuated .

documents.title: fly-tipping attracting professional criminals
text: professional criminals are now involved in illegal dumping , according to an officer at south norfolk district council .
david fergus says it 's a widespread problem and people need to make sure that offers to dispose of their rubbish are n't too good to be true .

`` as the price of disposing of waste gets higher and higher , there are professional criminals who are engaged in these illegal practices and sometimes people are seduced by people offering very cheap services for the disposal of waste . ''
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: emergency crews dealing with an incident in essex
text: emergency crews dealing with an incident in essex

documents.title: five illegal workers to be deported after raid on restaurant
text: five illegal workers are to be deported following a raid by immigration officers on a restaurant in norwich .
the home office raided the merchant of s restaurant in colegate last friday .
immigration offciers arrested four bangladeshi men who had overstayed their student visas and one who had entered the country illegally .
the restaurant was served a civil penalty referral notice and faces being fined up to £ 100,000 .
liz richardson , of the norfolk immigration enforcement team , said : using illegal labour is not victimless .
`` it cheats the taxpayer , undercuts honest businesses and cheats legitimate job seekers of employment opportunities . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: asparagus harvest begins early
text: norfolk 's asparagus harvest has started early , so just in time for easter lunch !
fine spring weather has meant that spears are already being cut up to a fortnight early .
andy allen , from portwood farm at great ellingham near attleborough , says it 's a little early boost and you 've got ten weeks to enjoy it :
`` the mild spring has warmed the soil up and the spears are now coming up .
we are gaining a bit of yield through starting earlier . ''
the asparagus season is a short one with farmers stopping cutting on 21 june .
author: Bob Carter
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: police appeal for help to find missing man
text: officers have released cctv in a bid to trace a man who has been missing from his home in clacton for more than a week .
nigel kedar , 52 , was captured on cctv leaving a shop in long stratton last week .
police say he visited norwich on 2 april and made his way on foot to long stratton .
he was last seen walking along the a140 at pulham market in the direction of the a14 two days later .
norfolk police has deployed a helicopter in the search and is now appealing for the public to help .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: free school gets go-ahead
text: a new free school for 450 children aged from five to 11 is to be opened in norfolk .
the sapientia primary prep school will be sponsored by wymondham college , england 's largest state boarding school .
the government has pledged to open 500 new free schools by september 2020 .
author: Bob Carter
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: stephen fry to talk about his mental health in new film series
text: stephen fry has appeared in a video talking to his psychiatrist about his mental health .
the film is the latest in a series created by heads together , the campaign spearheaded by the duke and duchess of cambridge and prince harry .
the series explores conversations that helped people cope with their mental health problems .
actor and presenter fry , 59 , who is a former director of norwich city fc and has a home in norfolk , talks with his psychiatrist , dr william shanahan .
in the film , fry said : `` it was very difficult but it was ultimately the healing thing , talking was a really strong part of the healing . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: off-duty medics save dad in park
text: the front page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: dijks is set to discuss his city future
text: the back page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: rise in claims for out-of-work benefits
text: a rise in the number of people in norfolk being counted as job seekers is being put down to a national change in the way benefits are paid .
universal credit - which wraps up all benefits into a single claim - requires more people to look for work to get their money .
figures for march show the number of people claiming benefits in norfolk has increased , year-on-year , for the eighth month in a row .
march saw around 8,500 claimants , that 's just over 1,000 extra compared to a year ago .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: norfolk tennis star to be both friend and foe to gb no.1
text: cantley 's alfie hewett will see a lot of great britain wheelchair tennis no.1 gordon reid today .
the pair will battle it out in the quarter-finals of the south africa open singles in johannesburg , before meeting on the same side of the net in the doubles .
the british duo will take on south african fourth seeds evans maripa and alwande skhosana .
hewett had an extremely successful 2016 , winning the wimbledon doubles alongside reid , as well as two silver medals in the rio paralym
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: more than 34,000 drivers caught speeding
text: more than 34,000 people were caught speeding in norfolk 's 30mph zones last year .
the highest recorded speeding offence was a staggering 105mph in these zones .
overall in 2016 , 50,000 people were caught speeding in the county .
the figures were obtained from norfolk police through a freedom of information request .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: weather : bright start with thickening cloud
text: a bright start this morning , but cloud will thicken through the day to leave things fairly dull this afternoon with a few spits and spots of light rain by the early evening .
highs of 14c , that 's 57f .
later on tonight , the outbreaks of showery rain will move away leading it to turn clearer and colder , with patches of frost in rural areas .
check out the bbc weather website for the latest forecast for where you live .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live coverage on wednesday 12 april
text: hello and good morning .
the team are poised to bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel as they affect our county .
do n't forget you can keep us posted with news where you are by clicking the `` get involved '' button at the top of this page .
the weather is up next .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage today
text: our regular news updates have now come to an end for the day , but if a major story breaks you 'll find the details here .
here 's a quick reminder of some of the news stories we 've brought you today :
we 'll head off now to enjoy the last of the day 's fine weather have a good evening .

documents.title: 'rise in standards at care homes over last year '
text: now back to our earlier story on research which shows a third of care homes in this county are failing .
norfolk county council has just issued this statement :
`` our priority is to make sure that people in care homes across norfolk have a safe place to live .
`` we understand that families want the peace of mind of knowing that their loved ones are well looked after .
although we do not run care homes directly , we are working hard with providers to hold them to account where standards fall short , as this is unacceptable .
`` we have already been taking action to address this , and our work with providers has seen a rise in standards at care homes over the last year :
`` we are currently running a pilot scheme with 25 services in a bid to drive up cqc ratings through focusing on better management of care .

`` we are also working closely with healthcare services to make education and training available , and encouraging residents to give us their views via an impartial , independent organisation so that providers can make improvements that make a real difference .
`` it is our policy not to make new placements in homes that have been rated as `` inadequate '' .
`` the official rating stays with a provider until the following inspection , which can be more than a year later , during which time the service has the opportunity to improve .
`` our quality assurance team uses a range of information to make assessments and inform decisions about making placements at providers rated as `` requires improvement '' .
`` we are working with providers across the county to attract new people to the care sector , which offers a variety of rewarding roles .
anyone interested can visit our new website www.norfolkcarecareers.co.uk . ''

documents.title: home secretary : 'real improvements ' in adult social care in norfolk
text: the home secretary amber rudd was in norfolk today .
she was here to campaign for conservative candidates in the forthcoming local council elections .
one of the main challenges facing councils today is how to look after our growing elderly population .
the care sector is struggling to retain staff - the east of england has the second highest vacancy rate after london , at 8 % .
ms rudd said the government takes the care sector very seriously .
`` elderly people in this country are hugely valued and we would always make sure that they are well looked after '' .
asked whether the system needed a complete restructure , the home secretary said :
at the moment we 're putting more money in , supporting local initiatives and in somewhere like norfolk we 're seeing real improvements in adult social care and i would hope that would continue . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: further coverage for city centre free wi-fi
text: free city centre wi-fi in norwich has expanded to include london street and the lanes .
in december 2015 , the norwich business improvement district ( bid ) launched the free coverage from chapelfield gardens to norwich castle , covering st andrew 's street and surrey street .
around 95 % of the main shopping area is now covered by the bid 's free wi-fi .

documents.title: weather : cloudy overnight with bright spells tomorrow
text: it should be a fine end to the day and staying dry this evening , although there could be some patchy light rain by the end of the night .
temperatures falling to about 6c , that 's 43f .
tomorrow will be cloudy with some bright spells , but with the cloud increasing from the north we could see some showery outbreaks .
highs of 14c , that 's 57f .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: betrayal , addiction and prison are in the past for mark
text: from alcohol and drug addictions to prison and homelessness , life has been a constant struggle for mark parkinson .
his difficulties started early .
at the age of 18 months , he was taken from his home in wisbech by his mother and a man he grew up thinking was his father .
they took him to cornwall .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: new owner for probation offices
text: an award-winning pub management team has taken on the former probation offices building in king 's lynn .
jeannette and anthony goodrich 's plans for the building include a cafe/bar , function room and bedrooms .
the couple , who own the rose & crown at snettisham and bank house in king 's lynn , say the development will create jobs and enhance the town 's waterfront redevelopment scheme .

documents.title: extra childcare places for norfolk
text: bignold school in norwich is one of three places in the county which have been awarded government funding to create more childcare places .
it 's to receive £ 261,000 from the department of education .
the norwich research park will receive a grant of £ 433,650 towards its plans for a 116-nursery facility , for staff and students .
in aylsham , £ 280,837 will go to the john of gaunt infant and nursery school , adding to a fund to create a new stand-alone nursery for 37 children .
a bid by norfolk county council last year led to a grant of £ 300,000 being awarded , to be shared between the rainbow centre at raf marham and scarning pre-school .
they 're expected to open their new nursery places by september .
the government is offering 30 hours of free childcare for three-to-four-year-olds , to be introduced from september , for working parents .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new childcare places for city school
text: more than £ 260,000 is being given to a primary school in norwich as part of the government 's policy to boost childcare schemes from september .
bignold primary will use the money to create 30 new places for children .
the school already has a 52-place nursery and a 40-place pre-school .
head teacher clare jones says the creation of extra childcare places will enable them to offer full daycare all year round .
bignold being a city centre school means that even if you 're not in the catchment area , if you work in the city it would still be somewhere for your child to be while you went to work .
we 'll be able to offer this with the 30 hours funding [ for parents ] that 's coming from the government . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: safes stolen in burglary
text: two large safes containing undisclosed sums of money were stolen in a burglary in norwich yesterday .
the safes were taken from premises on aylsham road in the early hours .
one was found in the ringland hills area , but the second safe is still outstanding .

in a separate incident yesterday , more than £ 10,000 was taken from a safe in business premises on market hill , thetford , after a man entered the premises at around 08:00 and threatened an employee .
police are appealing for anyone with information about either incident to contact them .

documents.title: 'be prepared ' for a wait to join the scouts
text: with activities such as archery , abseiling , raft building , hiking , climbing and camping on offer , it 's no surprise to hear that scouting is proving so popular .
here in norfolk , there 's now a list of 400 youngsters waiting to join , and more adult volunteers are needed to keep up with the demand .
penny harris , leader of 1st harling scouts ( below ) , says there 's a job for everyone , whether it 's working behind the scenes , or with the children .
she says it 's not surprising that the scout movement is so popular .
`` we 've an exciting and adventurous programme of activities it 's growing all the time , and the skills we 're giving them are skills that employers want . ''
brett was never a scout when he was a boy , but is now the assistant cub scout leader of the group .
i 've been hiking , camping , water activities .
i wish maybe i could have done that when i was a boy i get to help out and enjoy it as well . ''

documents.title: multi-million pound investment for john innes centre
text: the john innes centre .
( jic ) has been awarded £ 78m over the next five years by the uk biotechnology and biological sciences research council .
( bbsrc ) .
it will fund four new research programmes , looking into plant and microbial life :
the jic research centre in south norwich employs more than 300 staff , and describes itself as an independent centre of excellence in plant science and microbiology .
the funding is part of £ 319m awarded nationally .

documents.title: magic man wes is a gem for irvine
text: the story on the back page of the norwich evening news today :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: will city 's statues soon start to talk ?
text: the front page of the norwich evening news today :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: festival line-up announced
text: the line-up has been announced for this year 's reload festival , which returns to the norfolk showground in september .
grammy award winner billy ocean ( known for hits such as red light , caribbean queen and when the going gets tough headlines on the main stage .
other headline acts include 90s boyband blue - remember all rise and one love ?
the band has worked with motown legend stevie wonder and elton john , so expect some serious singalongs .
the main stage will also play host to level 42 , norfolk resident kenny thomas , odyssey ( and mungo jerry .
the event takes place on 8-10 september , and tickets go on sale today .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : river bridge now open
text: the a47 breydon bridge between great yarmouth and gorleston has reopened .
# a12 # breydonbridge is now fully clear following earlier rtc and all lanes in both directions have now re-opened between # a47 and # a1243
# breydonbridge # yarmouth is still closed .
traffic in area very busy , please avoid if possible .
updates will be posted when road has reopened

documents.title: stab victim remains in hospital
text: police were called to dereham road in norwich shortly after 18:00 yesterday , to reports that a man had been stabbed .
the victim was taken to the norfolk and norwich university hospital , where he remains in a stable condition .
no-one has been arrested , and police say they do n't consider there to be any threat to the wider public .
a man , who lives in the area , was walking past the co-op just after the incident happened .
he told bbc norfolk there was a lot of police activity in the area , as well as an ambulance and the air ambulance .

documents.title: 'whole generation let down ' by care home services
text: back to our story on the quality of care homes , which has been highlighted by the charity independent age .
its research shows a stark variation of care , with buckinghamshire .
and norfolk having the highest percentage of `` inadequate '' or `` needs improvement '' ratings in the east of england - 31 % and 29.7 % respectively .
this map show she number of individual care homes in these two categories in each local authority area ( bucks does n't feature in the charity 's version of the eastern region ) :
nadra ahmed is the executive chairman of the national care association .
she told me that a `` whole generation is being let down '' .

`` the person losing out the most is the service user a person who 's vulnerable and requires a service they 've been promised and have already paid for , through taxes and national insurance we should hang our heads in shame over this , '' she said .
in the spring budget , the government announced £ 2bn of funding for social care .
but ms ahmed says that when the details are looked at closely , the money is n't for frontline services - instead it will go to local authorities .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: webber intends to end transfer trouble
text: city 's new chief believes recruitment failings are behind failed campaign - the story on the back page of the eastern daily press today :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: speeding : there are simply no excuses
text: here 's the front page of the eastern daily press today : mum caught driving at 110mph on a11 told officers she was `` in a rush to get to the beach '' .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: travel : four vehicle collision on a47
text: the a47 near great yarmouth is closed at breydon bridge because of a traffic collision involving four vehicles .
norfolk police say the road will be closed for some time , and advise motorists to avoid the area .
a47 breydon bridge closed due to rtc .
please use alternative route # 1169
absolute chaos , son had theory test could n't get out of yarmouth so lost his place officers needed at fullers roundabout

documents.title: 'bird flu a constant threat ' to poultry farmers
text: a free-range poultry farmer in south norfolk says he 'll remain `` vigilant '' despite restrictions on bird flu being lifted this week .
since december , poultry in high risk areas have had to be housed indoors .
defra says the decision to lift the ban follows the latest veterinary and scientific evidence .
mark gorton , from traditional norfolk poultry in attleborough , says letting the birds out does n't mean they can relax .
the bird flu is a constant threat to our business and at all times we have to be vigilant to that . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: outstanding care home 'like a big family '
text: research has shown that a third of care homes in the county are failing but of course that means two thirds are doing well .
meadow house , in swaffham , is the only one in norfolk to be rated `` outstanding `` by the care quality commission .
it cares for adults from the age of 18 , all with different disabilities but not with dementia .
between them , lindsay and tracey ( on the right ) have worked at the home for more than 45 years , and they 've seen many changes in that time .
they tell me that everyone has different disabilities , but each person is treated as an individual `` we 're like a big family and our residents are the most important thing '' .
outside the entrance to meadow house is a plaque : `` this is not a house , it 's made into a home '' , and new staff are told they are coming into a home - the residents ' home .
belinda jones ( left ) , is the home 's activities organiser .
she 's part of a pilot project to share best practice across the industry .
she says you do n't come into this kind of work for the wages .
it gives you more than any other kind of job can do , it 's an absolute privilege to look after the people i 've looked after .
it 's a rewarding job , you go home feeling good about yourself and that 's priceless . ''
author: Wally Webb
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: 'third of care homes failing '
text: new research shows a third of care homes in norfolk are failing .
the older people 's charity , independent age , has analysed the quality of care across the country based on care quality commission inspections .
they rate homes as either `` outstanding '' , `` good '' , `` requires improvement '' or `` inadequate '' .
of the 317 care homes in norfolk , just under 30 % fall into the bottom two categories - that 's around mid-table nationally .
here 's how the figures break down in this county :
the charity says the government must tackle variation in care home quality in their forthcoming green paper on social care .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: hoolahan 's half-century
text: former team mates have been queuing up to pay tribute to norwich city 's wes hoolahan after he scored his 50th goal for the club .
the 34-year old scored twice in saturday 's remarkable 7-1 victory over reading at carrow road..
he joined the club from blackpool in the summer of 2008 .

paul mcveigh played alongside hoolahan for the canaries and he told bbc radio norfolk : `` whenever i played with wes you feel like you 're in a similar position and play similar games , but deep down i knew wes was better than me . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: travel : a47 reopens in both directions
text: the central reservation of the a47 in west norfolk is badly damaged following a traffic collision earlier one lane of the road is now open in both directions .

documents.title: defeat for canaries youngsters
text: norwich city 's under 23s remain bottom of premier league 2. after a 3-1 defeat by wolves .
ben godfrey was the only member of the side with any first team league experience .
he played the full 90 minutes as city fell two goals behind at afc telford 's new bucks head ground .
diallaing jaiyesimi pulled a goal back for the young canaries before wolves restored their two-goal advantage when donovan wilson scored his second of the game in the 86th minute .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: norfolk fa chief resigns
text: shaun turner has resigned as chief executive of norfolk football association after 11 years in the role .
he is standing down after being offered a job within his family 's business , but will stay in position until july while the search goes on for his successor .
mr turner has overseen a lot of change at the organisation and had recently been working with the football association at a national level .
he said : `` when people are constantly throwing abuse at you and sending criticism your way it does grind you down , but ultimately you know if you 're doing a good job .
`` it 's been a tough day .
i 've given my heart and soul to this job for 20 hours a day for the last 11 years . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: travel : a47 closed in both directions
text: emergency services are at the scene of an accident on the a47 in west norfolk .
motorists are advised to avoid the area if possible .
# a47 # norfolk closed in bothways btw # a17 # kingslynn and b198 # wisbech while we assist @ twitterid and emergency services with collision

documents.title: appeal after five cars torched
text: british transport police are investigating a five-vehicle arson at haddiscoe railway station during the early hours of sunday morning .
it happened just after 01:00 in the car park at the unattended station between lowestoft and reepham .
norfolk fire & rescue service put out the blaze and an investigation is now under way .
no-one was injured , a btp spokesman said .
someone set fire to five cars at haddiscoe station in norfolk .
can you help us investigate who is responsible ?
no cctv ?
no unfortunately this station does not have cctv at present
@ twitterid awful .
those poor people who own those cars .
hope you catch them

documents.title: weather : dry and bright with sunny spells
text: another pleasant day in store across the region , staying dry with bright or sunny spells .
winds will freshen through the day , becoming strong at times over higher ground .
highs today of 14c , that 's 57f .
if you 'd like a detailed forecast for where you live , you can have a look at the bbc weather website .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to norfolk live
text: hello and thanks for joining us for tuesday 's norfolk live .
the team is poised , fingers hovering over keyboards , ready to bring you the latest news from across the county .
if you 've a story you 'd like to share with us , click on the `` get involved '' button at the top of our page to get in touch .
it 's a bright , but chilly , start to the day georgina burnett will have the full forecast for you shortly .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage today :
text: that 's all from the norfolk live team today , we hope you 've enjoyed our coverage .
you can scroll down to see the stories we 've brought you but here 's a quick recap of the main ones :
unless there 's a major breaking story , our scheduled coverage will begin at 08:00 tomorrow .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingfashion firm with norfolk office collapses
text: fashion chain jaeger , which has 46 stores and a logistics centre in king 's lynn , has gone into administration .

documents.title: main road into norwich closes for ndr work
text: earlier today we brought you news that the northern distributor road ( ndr ) has taken a major step forward after steel beams were lifted into place to carry the rail line over the dual carriageway to the east of norwich .
but further west , motorists are being urged to be patient following the closure of one of the main arterial roads into the city .
the holt road between horsford and norwich has closed for four days for construction work on a new roundabout to link it with the ndr .
ultimately it will be permanently closed .
the first day of the closure has created confusion this ambulance was on its way to an emergency , but had to turn around .
it 's also causing frustration for drivers and local businesses .
farmer marie loveday and her son james say the road closure is costing them time and money .

`` we ca n't turn right out of our driveway , we have to turn left because of our land it 's an extra six miles , taking well over half an hour and we have two or three trips a day , '' ms loveday said .
`` it 's very time-consuming and is costing more money for fuel . ''
it 's also affecting charlie taylor , who has a window-tinting and vehicle-wrapping business .
customers are calling him asking how to get to his business , and he says this week `` is not going to be good '' .
norfolk county council has apologised for the delay , but says the £ 178m road will bring huge economic benefits to the county .
the road had to be closed for four days to link in a new roundabout to serve drayton lane , which links across to reepham road .
it 's really important we do that because that 's going to be the route for the b1149 when holt road is permanently closed , which will be towards the end of may , perhaps early june . ''
author: Debbie Tubby
BBC Look East

documents.title: weather : after showers clear , dry with clear spells
text: apart from a few showers before midnight it 'll be largely dry with clear spells across the bbc east region .
a ground frost could settle in some rural spots in the light winds as temperatures fall as low as 1c ( 34f ) .
however , many places will stay several degrees higher , between 4-7c ( 38-45f ) .
after a cold start , tomorrow will be fine and dry with some spells of sunshine .
the light winds will freshen during the afternoon .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
more details from bbc weather :
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: memorial laid to vc soldier
text: a world war one battle was taking place 100 years ago that would last for more than a month .
the battle of arras was fought from 9 april to 16 may 1917 , and it marked the beginning of the spring offensive on the western front in north east france .
thousands of soldiers lost their lives , but it was also a scene of incredible bravery which led to one man from norfolk being given the victoria cross .
in drayton , near norwich , yesterday a memorial set with a stone was laid to the memory of sgt harry cator .
sgt cator was born in the village and got married in september 1914 .
the next day he signed up , and went to war .
his actions in the battle of arras earned him the vc .
he realised his troops were pinned down , so he and another soldier went over the top , capturing a machine gun from the enemy , killing the soldiers to protect his own troops .
sgt cator went on to serve in world war two , where he was promoted to the rank of captain .

documents.title: trust 's statement on closure of skating rink
text: the following statement from sentinel leisure trust has just been released to us , following the sudden closure of great yarmouth 's roller skating rink .
it said : `` on 9 april sentinel leisure trust forfeited retroskate cic 's lease of the arena area of the marina centre .
`` the trust is however eager to find suitable activities or organisations including local artistic roller-skating clubs that wish to hire the space to enable continued community use and operations .
`` today we have made direct contact with both local artistic roller skating clubs and offered them use of the venue .
`` we have also made contact with the wrestling event organiser to see if we can support sunday 's event in any way . ''

documents.title: funding for research into orchards
text: a research group at the university of east anglia ( uea ) has been awarded £ 477,000 for a three-year project looking at orchards .
the landscape group will work with hundreds of volunteers and a range of organisations to survey and record traditional orchards across the east of england .
the national lottery funding will enable them to research the history of fruit growing and will also involve the restoration of important old orchards as well as creating new examples .

volunteers from bedfordshire , cambridgeshire , essex , hertfordshire , norfolk and suffolk will be trained to take part in surveys , and others will receive training in traditional orchard management .
head of the landscape group , professortom williamson , says they 're delighted to have been awarded the grant .
orchards are an important heritage resource , both in terms of biodiversity and as key features in our historic landscape . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'cannabis waste ' found by allotments
text: waste from a suspected cannabis factory has been found dumped outside allotments in great yarmouth .
borough council rangers up dozens of bin liners containing pots , roots and other growing equipment from tar works road .
a spokesperson from the council told me their rangers have searched the waste for evidence , and have reported the incident to norfolk police - who are seeking any information .
a similar dump of suspected cannabis-growing waste was reported last month .
alex macdonald is the secretary of the plots , and he says it 's a concern .
i would say there were over 40 or 50 bags .
i 've no idea where it came from .
it 's obviously been dumped during the night when no-one 's about but the police are on it now so there must be something going on . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: rink operators 'shocked ' to find premises boarded up
text: the operators of great yarmouth 's rollerskating rink say they were shocked to find their premises boarded up by their landlord this morning .
sentinel leisure trust has sealed off the retroskate part of the marina centre , citing legal issues as a reason to terminate the tenancy .
a short while ago , retroskate 's director gaynor read issued the following statement :
`` there is an ongoing issue with regard to the nature of the retroskate cic 's tenancy with sentinel leisure trust - a suffolk-based charity .
`` retroskate cic [ community interest company ] are in the process of initiating legal action to resolve the issue and hope to be operating again soon .
we will be working with our partners and customers to ensure that we can protect any existing functions .
`` our position is that we are not in breach of any of our contractual obligations and will be robustly defending this position legally .
`` we were shocked and upset to find that we could not access the retroskate cic rink this morning as we had been given no advance notice of sentinel 's proposed actions .

`` gybc [ great yarmouth borough council , which owns the marina centre ] are aware of the current status but we wish to make it clear that , as superior landlords , they have played no part in this current issue . ''
sentinel leisure trust has not yet responded to our request for a comment .

documents.title: norfolk 's constabulary remember westminster terror attack victims
text: officers and staff at wymondham police headquarters fell silent to remember pc keith palmer and the other victims who lost their lives in the westminster terror attack .
the funeral of pc keith palmer , 48 , is being held at southwark cathedral in london this afternoon .
thousands of police officers from across the country have lined the route of the funeral cortege .
police officers & staff held a moments silence to pay respect to pc keith palmer and all those who lost their lives in the wesminster attack

documents.title: another milestone reached in norwich by-pass project
text: massive steel beams that will span the norwich to sheringham rail line were lifted into place yesterday .
they 'll carry the northern distributor road ( ndr ) over the plumstead road , to the east of thorpe end .
each pair of beams weights 80 tonnes , and a 1,000 tonne crane was needed to lift them in to place .
the railway bridge is the sixth out of eight bridges on the 20km ( 12.5m ) route of the dual carriageway to have its main beams in place .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman injured by bullock
text: a woman suffered a head injury after being knocked over by a bullock this lunchtime .
the east of england ambulance service were called to wymondham road , hethel at around 12:00 .
the victim was taken to the norfolk & norwich university hospital for treatment to her injuries , which are not thought to be life-threatening .

documents.title: baby weighs in at 15 grams
text: cute alert !
the keepers at banham zoo could be forgiven if they had n't noticed the latest addition to their troop .
a white-bellied pygmy marmoset has recently been born , tipping the scales at around 15g ( 0.5oz ) .
it 's the world 's smallest species of primate , and once fully grown the tiny monkey will weight in at around 150g ( 5.3oz ) .
despite keeping a close eye on the parents and their baby , it 's still too soon for staff to know whether they 're celebrating the birth of a boy or a girl .
the pygmy marmosets are from the lowland forests of south america , and are not endangered in the wild .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: problems bring charity run to early end
text: a norwich man who 'd hoped to run from land 's end to john o'groats has ended his attempt just two days into his challenge .
three years ago dave reading smoked 60 cigarettes a day , but after his doctor told him he would n't survive another year he took up running .
it took 49-year-old dave a year to train ( here he is in norwich ) for the 837 mile ( 1,347km ) run , which he 'd hoped to complete in eight and a half days .
he 'd initially hoped to beat the world record , but decided instead he 'd run to raise money for charity .
but dave says he was beset with problems , including unforeseen roadworks and blisters that needed medical attention .
just two days after he set off on thursday morning , and around 100 miles ( 161km ) from the start , dave says he had to give up his challenge .

documents.title: retroskate closure : council statement
text: we 've just received this statement from great yarmouth borough council , following the sudden closure of the retroskate roller-skating rink .
the council owns the building , but the landlord is the sentinel leisure trust .
`` the council understands that sentinel have initiated legal action as landlord .
`` this is a matter between the landlord and sub-tenant .
the council would hope that sentinel will take the view that the space will continue to remain available to the artistic roller skating clubs to ensure that members are not disadvantaged .
`` the council can not comment further due to the legal position between these two parties . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: players must prove worth to city
text: `` new chief 's appointment focused minds ahead of superb victory - martin '' is the back page of today 's norwich evening news .
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: making our community a better place to live
text: army of helpers clear up area blighted by drugs and prostitution - the story on the front page of the norwich evening news today .
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: royals ' romp must herald new era
text: `` canaries hit the heights with seven of the best in webber 's maiden bow '' - the back page of the eastern daily press today :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: cycle challenge youngster raises money for cancer
text: do you remember the story we brought you last monday of six-year-old georgia stallard , who 'd cycled 50 miles in the netherlands to raise money for charity .
she made the journey on her little pink bike from the hook of holland to amsterdam with her grandpa .
she came up with the idea to raise money for the norfolk & norwich university hospital , which had treated her gran emma for oesophageal cancer .
i caught up with georgia earlier this morning , and she told me without the treatment `` nanna could have died '' .
her epic bike ride has raised £ 2,000 , and this lunchtime she 'll present the money she 's raised to the hospital .
author: Wally Webb
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: hundreds in convoy tribute to three teens
text: the front page of the eastern daily press today : car crash victims are honoured .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: seafront venue was expecting business as usual
text: great yarmouth 's retroskate website is still showing its timetable for the easter holidays , with skate sessions every day apart from easter sunday and easter monday .
retroskate , in the marina centre , was formed around seven years ' ago from a shared passion from its four directors who grew up roller skating .
it had been 20 years since the town had roller skating , and a whole generation had missed out on the fun .
when it opened , grandparents brought grandchildren along now it 's a whole family activity .
in december , clubs from across the country came to the venue to compete in the eighth annual national artistic rollerskating gala , with over 1,000 taking part over two days .

our reporter wally webb spoke to one of the organisers , gaynor read , at the time and she told him the rink is unique in the uk , as it 's the only one that 's made from terrazzo , a marble composite .
`` it 's what the italians skate on and they 're the world leaders , '' she said .
gaynor also told wally of their plans for the future .
ideally we 'd like to extend the rink which is what we 've submitted plans for .
our rink is rectangular and making it square would allow us to host the british championships and even international competitions too . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new research project into dementia in former footballers
text: more now on the criticism of english football 's governing body by the former norwich player chris sutton
he 's accused them of neglecting to look more in-depth into the link between former players developing dementia after heading heavy balls during their career .
the football association ( fa ) and the professional footballers association ( pfa ) have told us they acknowledge the criticism of past research failings .
they say they 've formulated a new research project in the last 17 months , and announced in march that independent researchers should begin investigating before the end of this year .
the research will focus on whether dementia is more common in ex-professional footballers than in the rest of the population .
the project is being jointly funded by the fa and the pfa .
dr charlotte cowie is the fa 's head of medicine , and she says it is a crucial issue .
player welfare is paramount and it is increasingly important that the football authorities investigate further whether there are any potential risks associated with heading the ball . ''
author: Nick Conrad
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: sudden closure of roller skating rink
text: great yarmouth 's roller skating rink has closed suddenly .
the main entrance to retroskate has been boarded up , and notices put outside the building , although there 's nothing on the retroskate website at the time of writing .
the notices explain that the landlord , sentinel leisure trust , has been inside the premises at the marina centre on the seafront and has terminated the periodic tenancy agreement with retroskate .
it 's the latest twist in a long campaign to keep the centre open , which included a 1,000-signature petition .

it goes back to september 2015 when great yarmouth borough council , which owns the building , and sentinel leisure trust came up with plans for a £ 6m redevelopment - but that included demolishing the retroskate area .
i 've asked the council for a comment , and they 've told me they 'll be issuing a statement later .
i 've also been in touch with sentinel leisure trust , but they 've not got back to me .
nobody from retroskate has commented so far .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: former player 's criticism of footballing authorities
text: those in charge of football have been accused by a former player of neglecting to investigate the potential links between dementia caused by heading heavy balls .
ex-norwich city goal-scorer chris sutton says the football association ( fa ) and the professional footballers association ( pfa ) have failed in their duty of care .
his father mike played professionally for several clubs and developed dementia in his 60s .

chris acknowledges that the fa have recently said they 'll conduct a study into a possible link , but says the footballing authorities have been disgraceful in the last 15 years in terms of neglecting hundreds of players .
we seem to be getting somewhere , but it 's late .
essentially the answer to all this lies in the likes of my father , the likes of duncan forbes .
these people are all affected , that 's where the answers lie the sensible thing would be to push this testing and get it sorted out . ''
author: Nick Conrad
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: footballer 's dementia 'caused by heading heavy balls '
text: the former norwich city striker chris sutton says more should have be done by now to investigate the links between football and dementia .
chris 's father mike has the condition , and his family are convinced his dementia has been caused by repeatedly heading heavy balls when he played the game .
the family first noticed things were n't right about six years ago , when mike - who played professionally for norwich , chester and carlisle - became repetitive , and started to say odd things .

chris ( playing for blackburn rovers ) says his father , who now lives in glasgow , has dwindled into a shadow of his former self , is on heavy medication and needs 24-hour care and he 's getting a lot worse .
all we can do is support him , sit and listen to him , he ca n't have a constructive conversation any more .
he can not be left alone .
he 's reliant on mum , extremely insecure if she 's not there , he 's like a little boy .
it 's an enormous strain on her . ''
author: Nick Conrad
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: footie project to help revive memories for people with dementia
text: football is being used to trigger memories and help people with dementia in norfolk .
norwich city fc and age uk have started the second project of its kind in the uk .
the memories of the game stay with those who are passionate about the sport , even when other areas of their memory are affected .
the sessions , at carrow road , will use memorabilia and talks by former players to help people recall names and certain moments from games in the past .
it follows a successful project in scotland .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: home win at norwich half marathon
text: the city of norwich half marathon was won by a runner representing the home club on sunday .
piers arnold of city of norwich athletics club was first to the finish line at the norfolk showground .
fellow conac runner ash harrell was second.. emma risbey from the winchester & district club won the women 's race .

almost three thousand runners signed up to take part in the event , which did n't happen in 2016 to allow organisers to move it to april after they had problems with the weather in its traditional november slot .
congratulations to everyone who took part in # norwichhalf this morning.the provisional results are now online
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: records tumble in big norwich city win
text: norwich city ripped up the record books by beating reading 7-1 at carrow road at the weekend .
the canaries scored six goals in the first half of a match for the first time ever at carrow road , their home ground since 1935 .
the last time they scored six in the first half of a match was against luton in 1908 .
it was the first time norwich have scored seven in a league game since beating southend 7-2 in 1955 .
wes hoolahan 's two first-half goals took him to 50 for the club since arriving from blackpool in the summer of 2008 .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: weather : cooler with a northerly breeze
text: hopefully you made the most of the summer temperatures over the weekend , but alas they 're not set to continue .
today we 're back to normal - much cooler with a cold front bringing some chillier air through , with a top temperature of about 13c ( 55f ) .
it will be mostly bright this morning , but turning cloudier in the afternoon with some isolated showers .
you can get more at bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: canaries captain emotional after remarkable win
text: norwich city captain russell martin dedicated the incredible 7-1 victory over reading at carrow road to club stalwart peter oldfield .
the players wore black armbands during the game in memory of peter who died last month..
he had been part of the matchday staff at carrow road for many years .
martin said : `` peter was a big character around the place .
i was away with scotland when i heard the news and i went to see him in hospital beforehand . ''
the city captain waded into the crowd to give his shirt to mr oldfield 's family at full-time .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: good morning norfolk
text: hello and welcome to a new week on norfolk live .
we 're here throughout the day , bringing you the latest news from around the county .
do n't forget to let us know what 's happening in your part of the county - click on the get involved button at the top of the page to get in touch .
georgina burnett 's forecast follows shortly without giving too much away , it wo n't be another day of `` costa del norfolk '' .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live
